This plate is in mint, never displayed condition and measures 6.25" x 8.25". It would be a great addition to your collection or gift idea for any Spiderman fan. Items.Name: 1940 San Francisco Souvenir View Book
Items.Description: This is a 1940 Souvenir View Book of San Francisco, with photos taken by Gabriel Moulin Studios. View book has 45 pages and measures 11 inches by 9 inches. Views include Ferry Building. Looking down California Street Hill, Sidewalk Flower Stands, Fairmont Hotel, Palace Hotel, St Francis Hotel, Mark Hopkins Hotel, Hotel Empire, The City Hall, The Municipal Auditorium, The Opera House and War Memorial, "The Lodge", Conservatory in Golden Gate Park, Japanese Tea Garden in Golden Gate Park, Fisherman's Wharf, Street Scene at Fisherman's Wharf, North Beach Section of San Francisco, Yacht Harbor, View of the City taken from Twin Peaks, San Francisco-Oakland Bay Bridge taken from Nob Hill, Golden Gate Bridge, Mission Dolores, Cliff House and Seal Rocks, Cliff House Beach and Esplanade, Old Chinatown, The Pan-American Trans-Pacific Clipper, The Fleishhacker Pool, Palace of Fine Arts, Coit Tower, Portsmouth Square, Alcatraz Island, and many more Photos. View Book in good condition but does have some paper loss to the covers. Bottom edge does have some damp staining. Click the thumbnails to enlarge ____ _____ Presenting the most beautiful antique style Heriz rug made in large hard to find size of 12'x17.7 which is rare and made to special order for upscale galleries offered at way higher price than it is being offered to you. So this is an opportunity Indians have a long history of producing hand made rugs and special talent in reproduction of rugs. After the recent revolution in Iran, many manufacturers and exporters of Persian rugs left the country and immigrated to European and American countries. The migration resulted in the knowledge of European taste and demand as they started a whole new era of producing handmade rugs in new design and fashion. They started reproducing antique Persian rugs in exactly the same fashion and techniques that were hundreds of years old, and surely were able change the trend by offering new production. Due to situations in Iran, most of the production took place in India. Production of Persian designs in particular reproductions of antique Persian rugs captured the American and European markets. One of the main rugs they promoted was the antique Persian Heriz, which have been one of the top names in antique rugs. Antique Heriz rugs are sold in upscale galleries for outrageous prices. Heriz rugs are famous for having soft colors and clear designs. These rugs have been targeted among designers and decorators all over the world. Most have a large central medallion embedded within a lighter field, and the main color scheme of the rug is usually some shade of brick Red. In addition to being decorative and beautiful, Heriz rugs are extremely durable and capable of handling heavy traffic, made to last life time. Unfortunately, not many antique Heriz rugs are around and when they are, you find them with a lot of wear and outrageous prices. These rugs are made of the finest handspun wool on cotton foundation. Heriz rugs bring lots of attraction and decoration to any room, as they can easily compliment your traditional furniture, as well as with modern and contemporary settings. Since they have been fashionable rugs for hundreds of years, they will never go out of fashion and will always maintain their classic spirit, accumulating age and history as they are passed down from generation to generation. _____ Satisfaction Guaranteed _ _ Bid with confidence, if you are not satisfied with your item you may return it within a week for refund less shipping charges. Items.Description: Wonderful Unusual Antique Christmas Tree Ornament - Circa 1930's - 1940's, perhaps even older - A Superb Find! Just in time for the holidays and fresh out of an estate sale in the Pocono Mountains of Pennsylvania, Gosla Antiques & Collectibles is pleased to offer this fine hand made Christmas ornament. This lovely ornament measures approximately 10" overall, not counting the wire hook. Lovely chain woven tinsel like metal. Many strands. Ending with colorful pink plastic beads. One of two like this we are listing simultaneously. Excellent condition. We're not positive of the age, but we estimate that they are from the 1920-1940's. Possibly German in origin. Items.Name: Dept 56 NEV Mill Creek Crossing FREE SHIP
Items.Description: Dept 56 NEV Mill Creek Crossing FREE SHIP FREE SHIPPING This is Department 56 #56623 New England Village " Mill Creek Crossing " . A new England setting is hardly complete without the romantic covered bridge. You can almost hear the echo of the clip-clopping horse hooves coming from inside. This impressive bridge features a wood frame and a slightly bowed roof, perhaps from the weight of the snow from many harsh New England winters. The wooden siding is painted a traditonal red and the floor of the bridges is made from local fieldstones. This nostalgic piece is a must for any New England village display and would make a wonderful and much appreciated gift for a collector. This early American covered bridge is MIB and has only been removed for inspection and photographing. Items.Name: Radko SCARECROW WIZARD OF OZ Discontinued '98
Items.Description: An American Cultural Icon for Your Christmas Tree Here is a beautiful blown glass representation of the lovable, bumbling and cerebral character of the Wizard of Oz. The Scarecrow has a handsome face and a charm all his own, in this limited edition Christmas ornament, made in Poland by the famous Christopher Radko. He's part of a series of Wizard of Oz ornaments sold exclusively by the Warner Brothers Studio Store in the 1998 season. There was a scheduled run of 10,000 of these -- this one is numbered 1052. And since the Warner Brothers stores have been closing one-by-one coast-to-coast, this may be an item that was more rare than anticipated. This ornament has been lovingly stored in a climate controlled environment. No excessive heat, cold or humidity. This ornament has been displayed over the holidays at least once before. But this piece has always been put away better than it came from the store -- in acid-free archival tissue paper -- inside a ziploc bag to protect it from outside moisture -- and with extra padding. You'll find Radko's original tag enclosed as well. The box is in good condition. We've treated our Radko ornaments as treasured investments. We hope you will too. The Scarecrow originally sold for $45, when he was introduced in 1998. Please note that the opening bid is far below that, and the value of this lovely ornament should increase as years go by. So, if you would like something special from the Yellow Brick Road to bring a little bit of Oz to your Christmas tree, enter your opening bid now. Thanks for looking! Good luck! And Happy Holidays! Winning bidders will cover the cost of insured USPS Priority Mail. Item will be promptly shipped after a Billpoint or PayPal payment receipt; or upon receipt of a Money Order. Personal checks accepted, but item will be held for 10 business days after receipt of the check. Thanks again.

Items.Name: Haunting SF Original Painting -- Hello? ...NR
Items.Description: Hello? After a couple years in the great Silicon Valley I've decided that there is another thing that is lacking out here -- in addition to profits, start-up business plans and steady jobs -- there's no wall space [and @#!* little storage]. So, I've made the painful decision to keep a core and release back to the cosmos over half of the collection of Science Fiction, Fantasy and Comic original art I've gathered over the last 20 years. All these will be listed over the next two weeks with minimum bids less than half their pre-1990 appraised value -- and NO RESERVES . Please visit my other auctions for at least a .. visual pause... of more great SF&F originals. I_ve loved them, you may too. Hello? is an original, signed painting by George Todd, done in 1985. It is approximately 8 inches by 5 inches, done in acrylic. I bought it from the artist at the NASFIC artshow in Phoenix, and the piece is in excellent condition [It has usually lived in sight near my desk]. While smaller, it is a superb piece....and reminds us that everyone fears the new, but still explores. Buyer owns the original painting only, all other reproduction rights reserved by artist. Items.Name: POP BOTTLE MAGIC TRICKS COMBO
Items.Description: (NOTICE: Payment accepted by BILLPOINT or PAY PAL ONLY. NO transactions by mail. No sale or shipment outside U.S.A.) POP BOTTLE MAGIC COMBO TWO AMAZING TRICKS (1) STARTLING POP BOTTLE PRODUCTION THERE IS NO FASTER BOTTLE PRODUCTION IN MAGIC! Imagine this effect: Away from all furniture or people, with your empty hands you pick up an empty sheet of newspaper, which you show all around, all sides of it. Then with no false moves, with your hands and the newspaper well away from your body, you crumple up the newspaper into a ball. Instantly, out of the balled-up newspaper pops a real bottle of pop or beer, which you can drink, give to spectator, or pour into a glass. The production is just that quick and just that clean! No suspicious moves. No steals from tables, chairs, or other persons. No sleeve load. No spills. No skill. The production is equally amazing on stage or in front of small audiences. I have used it in TV commercials and in shows of all kinds. Not an impromptu trick. You receive clear, complete, illustrated instructions and an astonishingly effective but very simple device. PLUS (2) SIR ISAAC NEWTON WOULD FLIP HIS LID IF HE SAW THE POP or BEER BOTTLE ANTIGRAVITY TRICK! THE PICTURE SHOWS THE TRICK IN ACTUAL OPERATION. YOU SEE SEVERAL TOOTHPICKS AND A PENCIL THAT HAVE BEEN INSERTED INTO THE MOUTH OF THE INVERTED BOTTLE OF WATER. THE TRICK NOW COMES WITH TWO OF THE GIMMICKS SO YOU WILL ALWAYS HAVE A SPARE! This is a famous and excellent impromptu pocket trick, endorsed by renowned magician and author, Dr. Harlan Tarbell, and many other famous magicians. Dr. Tarbell is said to have carried one of these "invisible" gimmicks for amazing "impromptu" performances. Dr. Tarbell wrote about how he used the effect in his shows, and wrote about its inventor, John Isely. John Scarne published a makeshift version of the trick in his magic book, although he did not reveal the real secret. This amazing trick depends on a very simple but ingenious little unseen gimmick that is always ready and extremely easy to use. You can carry this "little wonder" with you at all times. You will then be ready to baffle onlookers any place that you can simply borrow a pop bottle or beer bottle of water. Spectators watch closely as you take an unprepared bottle of water and turn it totally upside down, yet the water obeys your magical command and DEFIES GRAVITY--THE WATER DOES NOT RUN OUT OF THE BOTTLE! To prove it's real, you insert matches, toothpicks, and pencils into mouth of inverted bottle--they float up to the top of the water--yet THE WATER STILL DOES NOT RUN OUT OF THE BOTTLE. The water remains suspended in the inverted bottle until you will it to pour out! Spectators may examine the bottle with a microscope! REMEMBER, SPECTATOR MAY FILL THE BOTTLE, EXAMINE IT BEFORE AND AFTER YOUR TRICK, AND EMPTY IT. Some of my customers produce a pop bottle of water using our Startling Pop Bottle Production, hand the bottle out for examination, then take the bottle back and immediately perform this antigravity trick. Perform this anywhere, anytime. No skill required. "Impromptu" tricks as outstanding and effective as this one are few, but even one such trick performed properly can greatly enhance a magician's reputation. You receive original, copyright, clear, step-by-step instructions and presentation tips that make the performing very easy. REMEMBER, I NOW PROVIDE YOU WITH TWO OF THE "ANTIGRAVITY" GIMMICKS SO YOU WILL HAVE A SPARE IF YOU SHOULD LOSE ONE. THE POP BOTTLE MAGIC COMBO - BOTH THE ABOVE TRICKS - $10.97 PLUS $1.26 SHIPPING. TERMS OF SALE Winton H. Bieber, Ph.D. Winton H. Items.Name: VINTAGE HARD MAPLE WOOD PASTRY ROLLING PIN NR
Items.Description: Welcome to the Holiday Season. Being offered for your consideration, with NO RESERVE , is this wonderful Vintage Hard Maple Rolling Pin. Dating back to the 17th century, rolling pins were originally hand carved from various hard woods. Mass production began during the late 1800's, and by 1902 the Sears Roebuck Company introduced the first revolving handled rolling pin. This particular rolling pin has revolving handles, and is made of hard maple wood. The grain of the maple wood is beautiful. Measuring 18" in total length, this piece is in wonderful condition. The wood has been well preserved with no scratches or defects, and both revolving handles turn freely and smoothly. ~ PLEASE NOTE ~ that I have two additional rolling pins currently on Ebay. Items.Name: Postal Telegraph 1935 Western Union Telegram
Items.Description: This auction is for (3) Telegrams dated from the 1925 and the 1935 era. (1)The top one is a Postal Telegraph (The International System, Commercial Cables, All American Cables,Mackay Radio, with the Telegrams-Cablegrams-Radiograms symbol) received at Boise, Idaho 1003 Main St. Phone 2740 and dated Jan. 18th, 1935 @ 6:06PM. It is to Asher B. Wilson= Chairman Idaho State Repeal League Care Owyhee Hotel Boise, Idaho. It intails about District Judge Barclay at Jerome, Idaho has ruled that Idaho has had no dry law and is from The American Medicinal Spirits Company. This Blue telegraph has some minor ink bleeds on it from being folded and the usual crease folds throughout the telegraph. (2) The middle one a Western Union Telegram dated May 28, 1925 to Mr. Thoman at the First National Bank Building in Twin Falls, Idaho. It intails about concerns of Kent Stock Certificates & Marine Rights being delivered. It is from Asher B. Wilson- who was a prominent Twin Falls Lawyer in the early 1920's and later ran for Democratic Governor for the State of Idaho. This Western Union Telegram has a few minor crease folds and a small pencil smear at the bottom area. (3) The bottom one is also a Western Union Telegram with a Today is Friday Stamp stuck to it. It is dated June 5, 1925 and is to Asher B. Wilson of Twin Falls, Idaho asking if a check has been mailed on the Kent Stock, from D.L. Mayhew out of Long Beach, California. These Telegrams are all in fine condition for their age, with monor creases a a few minor tears. These would make a fine addition to any Telegram Collection or Idaho interests. Items.Description: A.nounder {text-decoration:none;color:blue;font-weight:normal} A.nounder:hover {text-decoration:none;color:blue;font-weight:bold} A.nounder1 {text-decoration:none;color:navy;} A.nounder1:visited {text-decoration:none;color:navy;} A.nounder1:link {text-decoration:none;color:navy;} A.nounder1:hover {text-decoration:underline;color:blue;} _ Persian Rug Old 2x3 Hamadan NR (#17462) _ __ Click Photo to ZOOM!! See the details of this rug! __ __ __ _ _ Edonia Number: 17462 _ Design: Hamadan _ Country of Origin: Iran _ Material: 100% Wool _ Type: Hand-knotted _ Exact Size: 2'3" x 4'1" 27" x 49" 69cm x 124cm _ Condition: Good _ Age Category: Old _ Suggested Retail: $349 _ Shipping&Handling: $21 _ __ __ Click to learn more about Edonia Guides & Publications. _ Hamadan Rather than being the name of a particular design, Hamadan is actually the collection center serving some 700 villages in the area. The designs of this region are varied and are not used as a guide to the origin of the rug. Distinctive designs are associated with particular towns and villages such as Bibikabad, Ingelas, Dergezin, and Husianabad, all are generally referred to as Hamadans. Key characteristics are similarities in weave and colors. Almost all Hamadans are single wefted, a row of weft runs between each row of knots, using the Turkish/Symmetrical knot, with 40-100 knots per square inch. Most of the rugs of this region use similar strong, dark colors, including reds, blues, ivory and brown. Often they are woven mixing goat or camel hair mixed with wool or cotton. Designs are bold and geometric, incorporating many hexagonal and diamond-shaped designs including sharply angled medallions and zigzag patterns, which represent lightening. Stylized florals and utilization of the herati pattern are also quite common. Many older pieces, mostly runners, were woven on wool foundations with undyed camel hair and are therefore camel colored. Modern rugs have cotton foundations with stronger, darker colors, often with bright accent colors. It is now very rare to find them in the classic camel color. Hamadans are considered some of the best values in Persian rugs. _ Click HERE for answers to Frequently Asked Questions (FAQ). Items.Name: NOT BRAND ECHH #6 Marvel 1967 COMEDY; VF+
Items.Description: NOT BRAND ECHH 6 VF+ check out all our Kochcom glossy silver age auctions . . . THE SILVER AGE IS BACK!! Ah, the 60's... Marvel Comics was revolutionizing the industry with their dynamic page layouts, deft characterization and fun, fun, fun dialogue. We're bringing back the most fun you can have with superhero comics, and bringing it back in style! Watch out, FOOM-folk- Marvel has unleashed their riot inducing, laugh bag of humor tricks and satirical shtick! It's "Not Brand Echh!", the yuk fest of un realized proportions!!! Led by the stalwart Forbush Man, This magazine may kill you from the laughter it will cause you to produce. Or maybe not...but you won't know until you read it....and how can you stand the suspense? Not Brand Echh #6 (2/68) Laughs abound once again with Marvel's brand of merry mirth! First on deck in this laugh line is "The Human Scorch Meet The Family" By Stan Lee and Jack Kirby featuring comedic charactures of The Inhumans, Sandman and various other characters in the Fantastic Four family. Then, in an amazing fit of wit and verve, Gray Fredrick, Roy Thomas and Tom Sutton create "Best Side Story" - its "West Side Story", but with Marvel and DC characters playing The Jets and The Sharks! Finally from Gary Friedrich and Marie Severin come "The Wedding Of Spidey-Ham, or...With This Ring, I Thee Web!" Oh, for fun! Glossy, Beautiful Very Fine + copies! Since then he has made a strong and exciting mark on the Pop Art world. From Super Heroes to Athletes, to Cartoons to Folk Heroes, from Social Awareness to Cigars, he explores and has a wonderful time putting it all on canvas in bright vibrant colors. He sees life in very colorful and fun ways. It shows in his art as well as his deeds. He inspires troubled youths to explore themselves thru art, AIDS awareness murals, the homeless, and donates much time and his art for charity causes. His subjects range from CAMPBELL SOUP CANS to MUHAMMAD ALI, FRANK SINATRA to SUPERMAN, VAN GOGH to MARILYN MONROE, MICKEY MOUSE to MICKEY MANTLE. He chooses subjects that are as colorful and fun as his art. This piece up for auction is a promotional card printed on a heavy stock, it was never offered for sale. Items.Description: This was the first Crisco basket made. The Crisco American series started in 1991 when the Longaberger Company was invited to create the official pie basket for the Crisco American Pie Celebration bake off in New Orleans. Items.Name: Lot of 3 YORK PA Ephemera 1933 Flood
Items.Description: ~ Lot of 3 YORK PA Ephemera 1933 Flood ~ For your consideration are two early postcards and one historical booklet for York, Pennsylvania. Postcard #1 is a nice condition 1912 postcard of "Goodwill Engine House, York, Pa." Card no. 300 by C.E. Wheelock & Co., made in Germany. Clean with beautiful surface, strikeover by tower. Card #2 is Card no. 8 by C.E. Wheelock & Co., made in Germany, postmarked 1910. Item #3 is a scarce copy of "York Flood 1933," printed for the benefit of Citizens Flood Control Organization. Soft cover, 9" x 6", 12 pages of pictures, plus pictures on front and back covers. Clean, no tears, small crease on back cover at lower corner, mild surface dust. Photos include ruins left by storm at Springwood Park, innundated York Quarries, Conewago Heights bungalow wreckage, swollen Codorus Creek, Felton borough devastation, and more. This is a nice lot for yourself or to donate to an historical society. Please check out "view seller's other auctions" to see other interesting historical books, postcards and ephemera.
